biography.content:
Clinician Post-doctoral Fellow,
Depart. of Oncology.
University of Alberta  2013- current

Assistant Prof, Pharmacology
Qatar University    2014-2015

I did my B.Sc. degree in Pharmaceutical Sciences at Alexandria University, Egypt. In 2002, I was invited to work as an instructor in the Department of Pharmacology, Alexandria University where I completed my M.Sc. studies. In the fall of 2006 I joined the Department of Pharmacology, University of Alberta as a PhD graduate student under the supervision of Dr. Richard Schulz. 
After my PhD, I joined Dr. Handzelâ€™s lab in 2013 as a Post-doctoral Fellow where I pursue my current research in cancer biology with special emphasis on DNA damage repair signaling/mechanisms. I am also a registered clinical pharmacist (Alberta College of Pharmacists). I joined CPH-QU the Fall of 2014 as an Assistant Professor of Pharmacology. I had to decline this position in January 2015 for family reasons. Now I am still working in my project with Dr. Hendzel, University of Alberta.
